page.title: 11RELIGION
page.content: The area lies entirely within the ecclesiastical parish of Caldwell. Within this parish the predominant religion is Christianity and the only place of public worship is in Uplawmoor.This Church of Scotland building ercted in 1888 as a 'chapel of ease' under the supervision of Neilston is now preparing for its centenary. Communicant membership contiues around 330 in spite of population changes,and the average attendance at Sunday worship is just over 100,with 45 youngsters on the roll of the Sunday School and Bible Class. The area has a small proportion of Roman Catholic families(2%).Baptists and Episcopalians are represented,as are 2 or 3 Jewish families.No other world religions are represented.
